alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 5:57PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Van Buren and southern Jefferson Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 556 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Leando, or 10 miles northwest of Keosauqua, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fairfield, Birmingham, Libertyville, Stockport, Lockridge, Douds, Leando, Van Buren County Fairgrounds, Glasgow, Morris Park, Mount Zion, Utica, Selma, Jefferson County Fairgrounds, Lebanon, Jefferson County Park, Collett, Round Prairie Park, Kilbourn and Beckwith. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
